message.content: This question requires some knowledge about the natural interactions and relationships between different animal species. Lions and hyenas are known to be in opposition to each other in terms of food and territory. They are both apex predators and often compete for the same resources, leading to conflicts between the two species. Option (A) is incorrect because while cats may hunt mice, they are not necessarily in opposition to each other for food. Option (B) is unrelated as dogs and sycamores do not have any natural opposition. Option (C) is also incorrect because while bears do prey on salmon, they are not in direct opposition to each other.
